Title:
Characterization of Xenorhabdus ( Î³-Proteobacteria ) strains
associated bacteria with the Steinernema isolates from Iran
Journal: Journal of Entomological Society of Iran
Keywords:
Xenorhabdus poinarii, Xenorhabdus nematophila,
Steinernema, characterization, Iran
Abstract:
A Gram-negative bacterium Xenorhabdus is mutualistically
associated with entomopathogenic nematode, Steinernema. Three bacterial
strains were isolated from the entomopathogenic nematodes of the white
grubs, Polyphylla olivieri in Iran. This study was focused on the
characterization of the bacterial strains. By using phonetic characters
and 16S ribosomal RNA gene sequence. This polyphasic approached led to
identifying all strains as Xenorhabdus spp., separated as X. nematophila
and X. poinarii. The phylogenetic position of those symbionts analysed.
Characterization of symbiotic bacteria associated with the
entomopathogenic nematodes is a main step to study of different aspects
of this complex. These results provide new insights into biodiversity of
bacto-helminthic complex in Iran.
